meanings.definition: To fertilize (a plant or crop) excessively.
meanings.sent1: The farmer accidentally overfertilized the soil, causing the plants to wither.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overfertilize the garden to avoid harming the plants.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked like it had a party with too much food when it was overfertilized.
meanings.sent4: The soil groaned under the weight of the overfertilized nutrients, suffocating the plants.
meanings.sent5: The overfertilized field resembled a buffet table overflowing with food, overwhelming the plants.

meanings.sent1: The overfertilized plants wilted under the weight of too many nutrients.
meanings.sent2: The overfertilized soil lacked balance, leading to poor crop growth.
meanings.sent3: The garden looked comically bloated after being overfertilized.
meanings.sent4: The overfertilized field was like a sponge soaked with too much water, unable to support life.
meanings.sent5: The overfertilized plants were like children given too many sweets, unable to thrive.
